title: THESE work habits are putting your sleep at risk, says study - The Times of India
summary:
THESE work habits are putting your sleep at risk, says study

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Times of India

The study underscores the impact of modern work habits on sleep health, suggesting that sedentary roles and irregular work hours are key contributors to insomnia.

  • 80% of the modern workforce is highly sedentary.
  • Surveyed more than 10,000 employees over a decade.
  • Those with sedentary jobs have a 37% higher risk of insomnia symptoms.
  • Individuals with non-traditional work hours have a 66% greater chance of needing 'catch-up sleep.'
  • 90% of insomnia-like sleepers had persistent symptoms over a decade.
“The way we are designing work poses serious, long-term threats to healthy sleep.” - Claire Smith

Employers are encouraged to redesign jobs to enhance employee sleep health, which is critical for overall well-being and productivity.
newTitle: Work Habits That Risk Sleep, Says Study

title: Sunil Gavaskar Predicts India's Next Captain After Rohit Sharma: 'He Leads From The Front' - News18
summary:
Sunil Gavaskar Predicts India's Next Captain After Rohit Sharma

Date: January 09, 2025

Source: News18

Legendary former cricketer-turned-broadcaster Sunil Gavaskar believes that Jasprit Bumrah could be India's next captain after Rohit Sharma, potentially taking over 'very soon'.

  • Gavaskar highlighted Bumrah's leadership qualities, stating he 'leads from the front' and effectively supports his bowlers without adding pressure.
  • Bumrah has already led India in key matches, including two Tests in Australia.
  • Rohit Sharma's availability and future as captain are under review after India's performance against Australia.
  • The BCCI is expected to hold a review meeting regarding India's leadership future.
  • Bumrah's role as vice-captain positions him as a strong contender, although workload management might be a concern.
“He could be the next man. I think he will be the next man. Because he leads from the front. He has got a very good air about him. The air of a leader.” - Sunil Gavaskar

The discussion surrounding India’s captaincy continues, with significant implications for the team's future performance and strategy.
newTitle: Sunil Gavaskar Predicts India's Next Captain After Rohit Sharma

Parvesh Verma hits back at Arvind Kejriwal: 'Gripped with fear of...' - Hindustan Times
summary:
Parvesh Verma said Arvind Kejriwal would soon start blaming the electronic voting machines for his defeat.

Date: Jan 09, 2025 10:55 PM IST
Source: Hindustan Times

In a heated exchange, BJP candidate Parvesh Verma criticized Aam Aadmi Party leader Arvind Kejriwal, stating that Kejriwal is fearful of losing in the upcoming elections and is using voter list discrepancies as an excuse.

  • Verma accuses Kejriwal of being gripped by fear of electoral defeat.
  • Kejriwal raised concerns about irregularities in the voter registration process for the New Delhi assembly.
  • Kejriwal reported that 5.5% of the New Delhi assembly votes were registered in just 22 days, suggesting possible fraud.
  • Verma claims that Kejriwal's popularity is declining among voters in New Delhi.
"Arvind Kejriwal is scared. The fear of losing has gripped him... Soon, he will start blaming EVMs for his defeat." - Parvesh Verma

The tension between the two leaders highlights the contentious atmosphere leading up to the elections as both parties prepare for a fierce electoral battle in New Delhi.
newTitle: Parvesh Verma Responds to Kejriwal's Allegations Amid Election Tensions

title: Ancient Geological Hotspot Linked to Great Lakes' Depth and Formation - Gadgets 360
summary:
Ancient Geological Hotspot Linked to Great Lakes' Depth and Formation

Publication Date: Not specified

Source: Gadgets 360

Evidence has emerged pointing to a significant role played by an ancient geographic hotspot in shaping the Great Lakes. Recent findings suggest that deeper geological processes may have contributed to their formation, providing insight into their extraordinary depth and size.

  • Researchers linked the formation of the Great Lakes to an ancient hotspot that interacted with the Earth's lithosphere millions of years ago.
  • The Cape Verde hotspot is believed to have influenced the Great Lakes region approximately 225 to 300 million years ago.
  • Seismic wave analyses show unusual horizontal wave movement beneath the lakes, indicating lithospheric deformation.
  • These conditions allowed ice to carve deeper and larger depressions, creating the unique landscape seen today.
  • The research reshapes understanding of the Great Lakes' origins, suggesting both deep-Earth processes and surface phenomena played roles in their formation.
“These findings reshape understanding of the Great Lakes' origins.”

The findings indicate a complex interplay between ancient geological processes and glacial activity, illustrating the intricate history behind one of North America's largest freshwater systems.
newTitle: Ancient Geological Hotspot Linked to Great Lakes' Depth and Formation

title: Who is SN Subrahmanyan, L&T chairman under fire for ‘90-hour work week’ remark? - Hindustan Times
summary:
Who is SN Subrahmanyan, L&T chairman under fire for ‘90-hour work week’ remark?

Date: Jan 09, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

SN Subrahmanyan, chairman of Larsen & Toubro (L&T), faced backlash for suggesting that employees should work 90 hours a week, including Sundays. His remarks sparked a significant response from the public and celebrities alike.

  • Subrahmanyan joined L&T in 1984 and became chairman and MD in October 2023.
  • His comments have been criticized by various stakeholders, including actress Deepika Padukone.
  • Subrahmanyan has overseen several major projects during his tenure at L&T.
  • He has received multiple awards and accolades, including the Eminent Engineer award in 2024.
“Shocking to see people in such senior positions make such statements. #MentalHealthMatters.” - Deepika Padukone

The incident has triggered discussions around work-life balance and employee well-being in a corporate context.
newTitle: Who is L&T Chairman SN Subrahmanyan and Why is He Under Fire?

  • The funeral service took place at the Washington National Cathedral and honored Jimmy Carter, who passed away recently.

“Kamala Harris is hated and shunned by everyone. Lovely.” - Alister Clisham

This event has sparked widespread discussion about Harris's position in the current political landscape and her reactions during significant events.

Joe Biden says he could have defeated Donald Trump: ‘I had the best chance’ - Hindustan Times
summary:
Joe Biden says he could have defeated Donald Trump: ‘I had the best chance’

Publication Date: Jan 09, 2025
Source: Hindustan Times

US President Joe Biden has stated that he believes he could have won the presidential elections if he had remained in the race, despite not knowing if he would have completed a full term.

  • Biden, 82, withdrew from the presidential race after criticism from his party following a poor debate performance.
  • Vice President Kamala Harris secured the nomination but lost the election to Trump.
  • Biden stated he thought he had a realistic chance of winning against Trump based on unspecified polling data.
  • Biden expressed regret over not effectively countering misinformation during his presidency.
  • He stated that infrastructure projects should have been initiated sooner for better outcomes.
“I really thought I had the best chance of beating him. But I also wasn't looking to be president when I was 85 years old, 86 years old. And so I did talk about passing the baton,” Biden said.

In conclusion, Biden reflects on his past electoral decision and the challenges faced during his term, expressing thoughts on misinformation and infrastructure delays.
newTitle: Joe Biden Claims He Had Best Chance to Defeat Trump

Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal has lodged a complaint with the Election Commission, requesting the disqualification of BJP leader Parvesh Verma from upcoming elections, citing serious allegations of an electoral scam involving illicit funding and corrupt practices.

  • Kejriwal claims that Verma is a key player in a larger electoral fraud scheme.
  • The complaint is linked to recent raids conducted by the authorities on Verma's premises.
  • The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) is calling for swift action from the EC to ensure fair elections.
“We cannot allow such corrupt leaders to participate in the electoral process,” Kejriwal stated.

This complaint raises significant concerns regarding electoral integrity and the potential impact on upcoming elections in Delhi.

title: PM Modi Flags Off Pravasi Bharatiya Express, Says Future Is Not In War, It Is In Buddha - News18
summary:

Date: January 09, 2025 Source: News18

Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated the 18th Pravasi Bharatiya Divas (PBD) Convention in Odisha, focusing on strengthening the bond between India and its diaspora.

  • PM Modi arrived in Bhubaneswar and was welcomed by key officials.
  • The PBD convention is a collaboration between the Centre and the Odisha state government.
  • Modi highlighted the upcoming Mahakumbh festival and its significance.
  • He mentioned Mahatma Gandhi's return to India in 1915 and its festive relevance.
“Pravasi Bharatiya Divas has become an institution to strengthen the bond between India and its diaspora.”

This event marks a special celebration of community ties and cultural heritage that PM Modi encourages for a peaceful future.

summary:
HMPV: No need to panic, follow Covid protocol, say city doctors

Date: [Date Not Provided]

Source: [Source Not Provided]

In light of recent concerns regarding Human Metapneumovirus (HMPV), city doctors advise the public to remain calm and continue following Covid protocols to mitigate potential health risks.

  • HMPV is similar to some respiratory viruses, including the flu and Covid-19.
  • Doctor emphasizes the importance of vaccination against Covid-19.
  • Symptoms of HMPV include fever, cough, and shortness of breath.
  • Public encouraged to practice good hygiene and seek medical advice if symptoms develop.
“It’s crucial not to panic and to adhere to the safety measures already in place.”

Doctors stress that while HMPV can transmit among individuals, adherence to Covid-19 safety protocols will help control its spread.

title: Trade Setup for January 10: Will TCS results take Nifty in the right direction? - CNBCTV18
summary:
Trade Setup for January 10: Will TCS results take Nifty in the right direction?

Publication Date: January 10, 2025 | Source: CNBC-TV18

Thursday's trading session favored the bears as the market saw a broad-based sell-off, with the Nifty 50 slipping below 23,550. Most sectors faced losses, but the Nifty's direction for the week hinges on the results from TCS, India's largest IT services company.

  • The Nifty 50 index ended at 23,526.50, nearing the day’s low.
  • TCS's revenue for the December quarter was ₹63,973 crore, down 0.4% from the previous quarter.
  • Foreign investors were net sellers while domestic investors were net buyers.
  • The Nifty has declined over 2% for the week.
TCS reported a revenue in US Dollar terms of $7,539 million, slightly below the expected $7,626 million.

This trading dynamic showcases the significance of TCS’s quarterly results on the broader market, particularly within the IT sector.
newTitle: Trade Setup for January 10: Will TCS results take Nifty in the right direction?

title: Two labourers injured as silo collapses at smelting unit in Chhattisgarh; two others feared trapped - The Hindu
summary:
Silo Collapse Injures Two Workers in Chhattisgarh

Date: January 9, 2025
Source: The Hindu

Two labourers were injured and two others feared trapped after a silo collapsed at a smelting plant in Chhattisgarh’s Mungeli district on Thursday, January 9, 2025.

  • The incident occurred around 1:30 p.m. at Kusum Smelters Private Limited.
  • Preliminary reports indicate that the iron silo, used for storing dust materials, crashed, trapping workers under the debris.
  • Rescue operations were launched shortly after the incident.
  • Two injured workers have been rescued and taken to a hospital in Bilaspur.
  • As many as 350 labourers work at the plant, which produces sponge iron.
  • Chief Minister Vishnu Deo Sai is overseeing the relief and rescue work.
“Sad news of an industrial accident has been reported at the smelters plant located in Rambod village of Mungeli district. [...] I pray to God for the safety of the workers trapped under the debris and the speedy recovery of the injured.” — Chief Minister Vishnu Deo Sai

Rescue efforts are ongoing, and the situation remains critical as authorities work to locate the trapped labourers.
newTitle: Silo Collapse Injures Two Workers in Chhattisgarh
